meta.reasoning: SESSION MANAGEMENT ASSESSMENT: For single-owner Facet app. Research shows session revocation useful for multi-device scenarios BUT: Single owner = probably 2-3 devices max (laptop, phone, tablet). OAuth tokens complicate this - Google/GitHub tokens don't revoke when Facet sessions end. PocketBase session model unclear. High risk of breaking auth (similar to security headers). Use case: Owner suspects compromise = could just change password instead. Estimated 3-4 hours but touches auth system = HIGH regression risk. Question: Does single owner really need to see/revoke own sessions?
